WorkItem.Description: RemoveFromCart Javascript needs to decrement the quantity, not remove the line item.
WorkItem.Summary: There is a bug in the RemoveFromCart method

Comments.Message:
Thanks Mr Jon Galloway for this sympathic tutorial. Thanks khacnhat for reporting this issue, that i've noticed too. I've tried your solution. It was a good idea but wasn't complete since the process still misfunctioned. Here's a sample of the four files I've slightly modified:
- RemoveFromCart method in ShoppingCart.cs model
- ShoppingCartRemoveViewModel.cs
- RemoveFromCart method in ShoppingCartControler.cs
- View/ShoppingCart/Index.aspx file (both Javascript function and table rows/cells ids to refer as)
To me, this issue seems fixed now. I hope you would agree. 
Regards.
Yep. noticed this too. Fixed it by having the RemoveFromCart method return an int of items remaining for that line item, and then passing that value to the view.

You can easily fix this issue with fixing JS requiring JSON... It has a spelling  "DeleteId" instead of what function really sends "DeletedId"....
ADD "D" do not need to modify half of the project.

Sorry for previous comment, though it is useful for those who fail to remove an item after copy-pasting like me.
Anyway, it's not a bug but "for simplicity sake issue" written by Jon
